title: When are we going to receive answers for Mac client users?
body:
I want to climb the ladder, I really do. I want to achieve high ELO putting in my absolute best of efforts.
With the Mac client, it's literally impossible to climb because every single game you enter, there is a risk you will be ruining the game for not only yourself, but  for 4 other team-mates who have no idea why you keep disconnecting/freezing/dropping fps, which immediately creates anger and frustration within these team-mates, which will lead to unnecessary reports. My last couple of ranked games I've entered, I've lost, simply because I let everyone down.

replies.body: I suggest you don't play ranked till it's fixed.

I decided to re-install the game, I can't even install it because it goes to 33% and the actual client shuts down.
I can't even.
Riot, please.

Oh, that sounds like a connection issue, not something which is Mac specific. Common solutions are to try manually setting your DNS, use a VPN (only while patching), triple check your firewall is allowing ALL instances of League to run (sometimes it blocks a specific version of League because it's new), etc.

If you were able to install League at any point in your computer's lifespan, then it's most likely a connection issue.

I fixed the installation issue, I manually stopped the Rads User Kernel process during the installation and it didn't crash during the rest of the installation at all. However, I still have the initial problem, client crashes during game :(

Interesting development just happened with me, my game crashed mid-game.

I'm on Windows, with a whole different set of things going on, but this could mean *it's a fault with the game, not your computer.* I strongly suggest you wait till the next patch until you do anything.
